meanings.definition: To twist or contort (something) out of shape.
meanings.sent1: She wried the wire to form a spiral shape.
meanings.sent2: He wried the rubber band to make a funny face.
meanings.sent3: The magician wried the balloon animals into strange shapes.
meanings.sent4: The vines wried around the tree trunk like a serpent.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor wried the clay into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The tabloid wried the facts to create a sensational story.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often wried the truth to manipulate public opinion.
meanings.sent3: The comedian wried the news report to make it sound ridiculous.
meanings.sent4: The artist wried reality in his abstract paintings.
meanings.sent5: The author wried the historical events to fit his narrative.

meanings.sent1: The wried tree branches formed a natural archway.
meanings.sent2: Her wried hair stuck out in all directions.
meanings.sent3: The pretzel had a wried shape that made it hard to eat.
meanings.sent4: The old fence had a wried appearance from years of weathering.
meanings.sent5: The wried path through the forest led to a hidden clearing.
